content:
TITLE: Installing and Running IRIS using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This bash script outlines the steps to clone the IRIS repository, set up the environment, and run the application using Docker Compose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#  Clone the iris-web repository
git clone https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web.git
cd iris-web

# Checkout to the last tagged version 
git checkout v2.4.20
# Copy the environment file 
cp .env.model .env

# Pull the dockers
docker compose pull

# Run IRIS 
docker compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Python Package Dependencies for DFIR-IRIS Web Application
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the required Python packages and their versions for the DFIR-IRIS web application. It includes core web framework components, database libraries, authentication modules, and various utility packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/source/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
azure-identity==1.10.0
azure-keyvault-secrets==4.5.1
celery==5.4.0
Flask==3.1.0
Flask-Bcrypt==1.0.1
Flask-Login==0.6.3
Flask-SQLAlchemy==3.1.1
Flask-WTF==1.2.2
flask-marshmallow==1.2.1
Flask-Caching==2.3.0
flask-cors==5.0.0
marshmallow==3.23.1
marshmallow-sqlalchemy==1.1.0
gunicorn==23.0.0
psycopg2-binary==2.9.10
pyunpack==0.2.2
packaging==21.3
requests==2.31.0
SQLAlchemy==2.0.36
SQLAlchemy-ImageAttach==1.1.0
SQLAlchemy-Utils==0.41.2
urllib3==1.26.18
Werkzeug==3.1.3
WTForms==3.2.1
Flask-SocketIO==5.4.1
alembic==1.7.5
setuptools~=70.3.0
python-dateutil==2.8.2
python-gnupg==0.4.8
pyminizip~=0.2.6
PyJWT==2.4.0
cryptography>=39.0.1
ldap3==2.9.1
pyintelowl>=4.4.0
pyotp==2.9.0
graphene==3.3
qrcode[pil]==7.4.2
dictdiffer==0.2.0
oic==1.7.0
# unfortunately we are relying on a beta version here. I hope a definitive version gets released soon
graphql-server[flask]==3.0.0b7
graphene-sqlalchemy==3.0.0rc1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Iris Web Chart with Helm
DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install the Iris Web chart with a specified release name and values file in a given namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
helm install my-release charts/ --values charts/values.yaml  -n <Name_Space>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Iris with Make
DESCRIPTION: Make command to install or upgrade Iris application using Helm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make install-iris
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Watching IRIS UI for Development
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the IRIS application and automatically rebuilds it when changes are detected. It's useful for active development work.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run watch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building IRIS UI for Production
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the IRIS application for production deployment. It creates optimized and minified assets ready for serving.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Building Docker Images for Iris-Web on AWS EKS
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Iris-web repository and build Docker images for the web application and database. These images need to be pushed to AWS ECR for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/eks_manifest/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#  Clone the iris-web repository
$ git clone https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web.git
$ cd iris-web

# Build the dockers (Build webApp and db docker images, skip the nginx because we using AWS ALB instead of nginx)
# app & woker:
$ docker build -t webapp:latest -f docker/webApp/Dockerfile .
# DB:
$ docker build -t db:latest -f docker/db/Dockerfile .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Iris-Web to AWS EKS using Makefile
DESCRIPTION: Commands to deploy and delete the Iris-Web application on AWS EKS using the provided Makefile. The make create command deploys the application while make delete removes everything except the database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/eks_manifest/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ make
$ make create
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for IRIS UI Development
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for developing the IRIS UI. It should be run before starting development work.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linting IRIS UI Source Files
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the linter on the source files of the IRIS UI. It helps maintain code quality and consistency across the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Auditing IRIS UI Packages for Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: This command checks for any known vulnerabilities in the packages used by the IRIS UI. It's an important step in maintaining the security of the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm audit
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding DFIR-IRIS License Header to New Files
DESCRIPTION: License header template to be added to new files in the DFIR-IRIS project, with ${current_year} to be replaced by the current year.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
#  IRIS Source Code
#  Copyright (C) ${current_year} - DFIR-IRIS
#  contact@dfir-iris.org
#
#  This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
#  modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
#  License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
#  version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
#
#  This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
#  but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
#  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
#  Lesser General Public License for more details.
#
#  You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
#  along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation,
#  Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301, USA.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Alembic Migration Script for DFIR-IRIS Database Changes
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Alembic migration script for database changes in DFIR-IRIS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
alembic -c app/alembic.ini revision -m <What's changed>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running All Tests for IRIS Web
DESCRIPTION: Executes all unit tests with verbose output using Python's unittest module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m unittest --verbose
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Specific IRIS Web Test Case
DESCRIPTION: Executes a single test case by specifying its fully qualified name with the unittest module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m unittest tests_rest.TestsRest.test_create_asset_should_not_fail
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking for Outdated Packages in IRIS UI
DESCRIPTION: This command lists any outdated packages in the IRIS UI project. It's useful for maintaining up-to-date dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm outdated
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Custom Wheel Files for DFIR-IRIS Modules
DESCRIPTION: This snippet enumerates custom wheel files located in the 'dependencies' directory. These files represent DFIR-IRIS-specific modules and integrations, including document generation, EVTX parsing, and various analysis modules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/source/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
dependencies/docx_generator-0.8.0-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_interface-1.2.0-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/evtx2splunk-2.0.1-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_evtx-1.2.0-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_check_module-1.0.1-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_vt_module-1.2.1-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_misp_module-1.3.0-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_webhooks_module-1.0.8-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_intelowl_module-0.1.0-py3-none-any.whl
dependencies/iris_seika_module-1.0.0-py3-none-any.whl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Python Requests Package Version Constraint
DESCRIPTION: Defines a version constraint for the Python requests package, requiring version 2.31.0 or newer, but less than 3.0.0. This ensures compatibility with the current application while preventing breaking changes from major version updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/tests/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
requests >= 2.31.0, < 3.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Correct Python Import Style in DFIR-IRIS
DESCRIPTION: Proper way to import multiple items in DFIR-IRIS Python code, with one import per line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from app import app
from app import db
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Nginx Ingress Controller with Helm
DESCRIPTION: Commands to add the Nginx ingress controller Helm repository and install it in a specified namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
helm repo add ingress-nginx https://kubernetes.github.io/ingress-nginx
helm install my-release ingress-nginx/ingress-nginx -n <Name_Space>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Dependencies with Make
DESCRIPTION: Make command to check if Helm and kubectl are installed, with automatic installation if missing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make check-dependencies
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Iris with Make
DESCRIPTION: Make command to delete the Iris application using Helm from the specified namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make delete-iris
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uninstalling Iris Web Chart with Helm
DESCRIPTION: Helm command to uninstall and delete the Iris Web deployment from a specified namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
helm delete my-release -n <Name_Space>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Ingress Resources in Kubernetes
DESCRIPTION: Kubectl command to list Ingress resources in a specified namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
kubectl get ingress -n <Name_Space>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Chart Information in Helm Template
DESCRIPTION: Outputs basic information about the Helm chart including release name, chart name, version, and description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/charts/templates/NOTES.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: helm
CODE:
```
Release Name: {{ .Release.Name }}
Chart Name: {{ .Chart.Name }}
Chart Version: {{ .Chart.Version }}
Chart Description: {{ .Chart.Description }}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Ingress Resource Display in Helm Template
DESCRIPTION: Shows information about deployed Ingress resources when ingress is enabled, including name, host, path, service name and port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/charts/templates/NOTES.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: helm
CODE:
```
{{- if .Values.ingress.enabled }}
Ingress:
- Name: {{ .Release.Name }}-ingress
  Host: {{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "host" }}
  Path: {{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "paths" 0 "path" }}
  Service Name: {{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "paths" 0 "serviceName" }}
  Service Port: {{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "paths" 0 "servicePort" }}
{{- end }}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Application Access Instructions in Helm Template
DESCRIPTION: Provides instructions for accessing the application based on whether ingress is enabled, including the domain URL if DNS is configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/charts/templates/NOTES.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: helm
CODE:
```
{{- if eq .Values.ingress.enabled true }}
To access your application, ensure that the necessary configurations are set up in your cluster.

- If you have DNS set up:
  - Access your application using the configured domain: http://{{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "host" }}
{{- else }}
No Ingress resources deployed.
{{- end }}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Service Information Display in Helm Template
DESCRIPTION: Shows information about the application service including service name and port, using variables from the values file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/charts/templates/NOTES.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: helm
CODE:
```
Ensure that your application service ({{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "paths" 0 "serviceName" }}) is up and running on port {{ index .Values.ingress.hosts 0 "paths" 0 "servicePort" }}.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Git Feature Branch for DFIR-IRIS Development
DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and pushing a new feature branch from the develop branch in the DFIR-IRIS git repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git switch develop
git switch -c <branch-name>
git push --set-upstream origin <branch-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rebasing DFIR-IRIS Feature Branch
DESCRIPTION: Commands for rebasing a feature branch against the latest develop branch in the DFIR-IRIS git repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git switch -c <branch-name>
git rebase origin/develop
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Python Virtual Environment for IRIS Web Testing
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Python virtual environment, activates it, and installs required dependencies from requirements.txt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating Python Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Activates the previously created Python virtual environment before running tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source ./venv/bin/activate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Production Dependencies for IRIS UI
DESCRIPTION: This command installs only the production dependencies for the IRIS UI. It's typically used in production environments or CI/CD pipelines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/ui/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm ci
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Iris-Web Deployment from AWS EKS
DESCRIPTION: Commands to delete the Iris-Web application deployment from AWS EKS using the provided Makefile. This will remove all components except the database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/eks_manifest/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ make
$ make delete
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Admin Credentials for Iris-Web on AWS EKS
DESCRIPTION: Commands to retrieve the administrator username and password from the Iris-Web application pod logs after deployment on AWS EKS. The credentials are displayed at the end of the pod logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/eks_manifest/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ kubectl get pod -n iris-web
# Copy the pod name and give it on the below command (pod name looks like "pod/iris-app-deployment-ðŸŽ²")
$ kubectl logs <pod_name> -n iris-web
# You can see the credential at the end of the logs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Iris Web Repository
DESCRIPTION: Git command to clone the Iris Web repository from GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Incorrect Python Shebang Usage in DFIR-IRIS
DESCRIPTION: Example of a shebang that should not be used in DFIR-IRIS Python files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
#!/usr/bin/env python3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Incorrect Python Import Style in DFIR-IRIS
DESCRIPTION: Example of multiple imports on a single line, which should be avoided in DFIR-IRIS Python code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/blob/master/CODESTYLE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from app import app, db
```
